summary: This course is the original Cisco course offered as part of the CISCO IT Academy program at Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber. The course provides comprehensive training in networking concepts and practical skills, including configuring and verifying IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, VLANs, interswitch connectivity, Layer 2/Layer 3 EtherChannel, static routing, OSPFv2, NAT, NTP, DHCP, and SSH. It also covers wireless principles, network security concepts, and device access control. The hybrid course is conducted both on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, offering flexibility to participants. The course spans 17 sessions (85 academic hours) and includes both theoretical and practical components. The start date is January 3, 2025, with classes held on Tuesdays (17:30-21:30) and Fridays (09:00-13:00).

COURSE NAME: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE OVERVIEW: This is the original Cisco course, part of the Cisco IT Academy program, offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. The course provides comprehensive training to acquire the sought-after IT certification.

COURSE LEADERSHIP: The course is part of the Bar-Ilan University IT Academy program, under the School of High-Tech and Cyber.

CERTIFICATIONS: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE SCHEDULE:
- Start Date: 03.01.2025.
- Duration: 17 sessions over 85 academic hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT:
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on the participant's choice.

COURSE TOPICS:
- Explain the role and function of network components.
- Describe characteristics of network topology architectures.
- Compare physical interface and cabling types.
- Configure and verify IPv4 addressing and subnetting.
- Configure and verify IPv6 addressing and prefix.
- Describe wireless principles.
- Configure and verify VLANs (normal range) spanning multiple switches.
- Configure and verify interswitch connectivity.
- Configure and verify Layer 2 discovery protocols.
- Configure and verify (Layer 2/Layer 3) EtherChannel (LACP).
- Describe AP and WLC management access connections.
- Interpret the components of the routing table.
- Configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 static routing.
- Configure and verify single area OSPFv2.
- Configure and verify inside source NAT using static and pools.
- Configure and verify NTP operating in a client and server mode.
- Configure and verify DHCP client and relay.
- Configure network devices for remote access using SSH.
- Define key security concepts (threats, vulnerabilities, exploits, and mitigation techniques).
- Describe security program elements (user awareness, physical access control).
- Configure device access control using local passwords.
- Describe security password policies elements.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION:
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin.
- Phone: 052-5886002.
- Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber, under the framework of dedicated programs at Bar-Ilan University.
